page.title: 13The District of Harlescott.
page.content: The district of Harlescott covers a large area of land which was mainly farm land, until the need for more housing arose in the early nineteen fifties. This was the start of two housing programmes by the local council,, the first part was the Sundorne side (Meadows estate)and the other land called Grange Farm.The site of the old farmhouse is where the anchor pub now stands,and one of the churches by the shops was a stable. At the back is the Grange which is a square sourounded by and sandstone wall here once stood a large timbered house which has long since gone. In addition to the housing esates there are general industrial premises; one of which was the factory where the Sentinel Steam Waggon was built.
